info.title: Welcome to resto
info.description: A metadata catalog and search engine for geospatialized data

id.description: Collection identifier. It must be an unique alphanumeric string containing only [a-zA-Z0-9\-_].

description.description: Detailed multi-line description to fully explain the Collection. CommonMark 0.29 syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

visibility.description: Visibility of this collection. Collections with visibility 1 are visible to all users.

model.description: [For developper] Name of the collection model class under $SRC/include/resto/Models - Default is DefaultModel

license.description: License for this collection as a SPDX License identifier. Alternatively, use proprietary if the license is not on the SPDX license list or various if multiple licenses apply. In these two cases links to the license texts SHOULD be added, see the license link relation type.

download.description: Feature download rights (1 can be downloaded; 0 cannot be downloaded)

visualize.description: Features visualization rights (1 can be visualized; 0 cannot be visualized)

keywords.description: List of keywords describing the collection.

providers.description: A list of providers, which may include all organizations capturing or processing the data or the hosting provider. Providers should be listed in chronological order with the most recent provider being the last element of the list

en.Description: The SENTINEL-2 mission is a land monitoring constellation of two satellites each equipped with a MSI (Multispectral Imager) instrument covering 13 spectral bands providing high resolution optical imagery (i.e., 10m, 20m, 60 m) every 10 days with one satellite and 5 days with two satellites
en.Tags: copernicus esa eu msi radiance sentinel sentinel2

fr.Description: La mission SENTINEL-2 est constituée de deux satellites d'imagerie optique équipés d’un imageur multispectral (MSI) en 13 bandes spectrales avec des résolutions de 10, 20 et 60 mètres et d'une fauchée unique de 290 km de large. La capacité d'observation des deux satellites permet de surveiller l'intégralité des terres émergées du globe tous les 5 jours
fr.Tags: copernicus esa eu msi radiance sentinel sentinel2

links.title: Legal notice on the use of Copernicus Sentinel Data and Service Information

id.description: Collection identifier. It must be an unique alphanumeric string containing only [a-zA-Z0-9\-_].

title.description: A short descriptive one-line title for the collection.

description.description: Detailed multi-line description to fully explain the collection. CommonMark 0.28 syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

keywords.description: List of keywords describing the collection.

license.description: License for this collection as a SPDX License identifier or expression. Alternatively, use proprietary if the license is not on the SPDX license list or various if multiple licenses apply. In these two cases links to the license texts SHOULD be added, see the license link relation type.

providers.description: A list of providers, which may include all organizations capturing or processing the data or the hosting provider. Providers should be listed in chronological order with the most recent provider being the last element of the list

stac_version.description: [EXTENSION][STAC] The STAC version the Collection implements

stac_extensions.description: [EXTENSION][STAC] A list of extensions the Collection implements.

links.title: Legal notice on the use of Copernicus Sentinel Data and Service Information

osDescription.Description: The SENTINEL-2 mission is a land monitoring constellation of two satellites each equipped with a MSI (Multispectral Imager) instrument covering 13 spectral bands providing high resolution optical imagery (i.e., 10m, 20m, 60 m) every 10 days with one satellite and 5 days with two satellites

OpenSearchDescription.description: OpenSearch description of the search engine attached to the collection

ShortName.description: Contains a brief human-readable title that identifies the search engine

LongName.description: Contains an extended human-readable title that identifies this search engine

Description.description: Contains a human-readable text description of the collection search engine

Tags.description: Contains a set of words that are used as keywords to identify and categorize this search content. Tags must be a single word and are delimited by the space character

Developer.description: Contains the human-readable name or identifier of the creator or maintainer of the description document

Contact.description: Contains an email address at which the maintainer of the description document can be reached

Query.description: Defines a search query that can be performed by search clients. Please see the OpenSearch Query element specification for more information

Attribution.description: Contains a list of all sources or entities that should be credited for the content contained in the search feed

count.description: Total number of features in the collection

Provider.description: A provider is any of the organizations that captured or processed the content of the collection and therefore influenced the data offered by this collection

name.description: The name of the organization or the individual

description.description: Multi-line description to add further provider information such as processing details for processors and producers, hosting details for hosts or basic contact information. CommonMark 0.28 syntax MAY be used for rich text representation

url.description: Homepage on which the provider describes the dataset and publishes contact information.

spatial.description: The spatial extents of the Collection

temporal.description: The temporal extents of the Collection

properties.description: Feature properties mainly based on *[OGC-13-026r8] OGC OpenSearch Extension for Earth Observation*. Only non null properties are returned

title.description: A name given to the feature

datetime.description: Start/end of feature life (e.g. start of acquisition for a satellite imagery) (ISO 8601 - YYYY-MM-DD-THH:MM:SSZ/YYYY-MM-DD-THH:MM:SSZ)

udpated.description: The date when the feature metadata was updated (ISO 8601 - YYYY-MM-DD-THH:MM:SSZ)

published.description: The date when the feature metadata was published (ISO 8601 - YYYY-MM-DD-THH:MM:SSZ)

hashtags.description: Array of hashtags attached to the feature

likes.description: Number of likes for this feature

comments.description: Number of comments on this feature

owner.description: Owner of the feature i.e. user that created it

liked.description: True if the user that requests the feature likes it

properties.description: Feature properties mainly based on *[OGC-13-026r8] OGC OpenSearch Extension for Earth Observation*. Only non null properties are returned

title.description: A name given to the feature

description.description: Descritipon of the feature. Each hashtag within the description is indexed to speedup search

datetime.description: Start/end of feature life (e.g. start of acquisition for a satellite imagery) (ISO 8601 - YYYY-MM-DD-THH:MM:SSZ/YYYY-MM-DD-THH:MM:SSZ)

returned.description: The count of results returned by this response. equal to the cardinality of features array

limit.description: The maximum number of results to which the result was limited

matched.description: The count of total number of results that match for this query, possibly estimated

exactCount.description: True if *matched* is exact - false means that it is estimated

startIndex.description: Start index for the search (cf. pagination)

id.description: Unique user identifier. Identifier is related to user's registration date i.e. the greatest the identifier value, the most recently registered the user is

picture.description: An http(s) url to the user's avatar picture

topics.description: Comma separated list of user's topics of interest

followed.description: True if user is followed by requesting user

followme.description: True if user follows requesting user

description.description: Detailed multi-line description to fully explain the catalog. CommonMark 0.28 syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

stac_version.description: The STAC version the catalog implements

rel.description: Relationship between the feature and the linked document/resource
Relationship between the feature and the linked document/resource

bearerAuth.description: Access token in HTTP header as JWT or rJWT (_resto JWT_) - this is the default

basicAuth.description: Basic authentication in HTTP header - should be used first to get a valid rJWT token

queryAuth.description: Access token in query as preseance over token in HTTP header
queryAuth.name: _bearer

tags.name: Collection
tags.description: A collection is a set of features. This set is usually homogeneous (e.g. *Sentinel-2 images*) but not necessary. A collection is defined by a *model* physically described within a dedicated class under $SRC/include/resto/Models. The purpose of the model class is to convert the input collection feature format (i.e. whatever) to the resto generic format (i.e. GeoJSON) described within the RestoModel class.

tags.name: Feature
tags.description: A feature is an application object that represents a physical entity e.g. a building, a river, a person, a coverage taken by a a satellite. Practically, a resto feature is defined by a set of metadata including a geographical location (i.e. a (Multi)Point, a (Multi)LineString or a (Multi)Polygon). A feature always belongs to one and only one collection.

tags.name: User
tags.description: Everything about user - profile, access rights, history, etc.

tags.name: Catalog
tags.description: A STAC Catalog is a collection of STAC Items
